title: A math. proof that Hexdrinker is broken and shouldn't be allowed to coexist with Nullifying Orb v2.0
body:
Syndra: {{item:3020}} {{item:3191}} (fully stacked){{item:3802}} {{item:1056}} 
AP: 102
Armor: 96
Magic penetration: 18
______________________
Zed: {{item:3134}} {{item:3155}} 
AD: 145
Magic resistance: 77
Lethality: 12

----------------------------------------------------------

Raw 6 spheres Unleashed Power damage: _662 magic damage_.

6 spheres Unleashed Power damage after damage mitigation without Hexdrinker: _536 magic damage_.

6 spheres Unleashed Power damage after damage mitigation with Hexdrinker: _417 magic damage_, - _200_ from the lvl 10 shield and _-90_ from Nullifying Orb = _127 magic damage_.
-----------------------------------------------------------

The close peak of Syndra's R burst was close to being completely denied from a single rushable item and a rune. _536 magic damage_ -> _127 magic damage_.

I had a fully stacked Keeper's Armguard, for _45 armor_. This item increases my physical damage resistance by _15%_ (_33%_->_48%_). Is it even close? I DO NOT think so.

Hexdrinker is broken for the assassins.
It should not be allowed to stack with Nullifying Orb.
Hexdrinker is way more cost efficient than Seeker's Armguard.

**_If the situation was reversed, i would have died to his burst. This is totally unfair and biased._**

Yes, inequality is normal and acceptable, especially when it appears between two individuals who are not equal.

None of what you said really applies when we're talking about the balance of a competitive video game. The simple fact this post presents, a fact that has been true for a very long time, is that against an AP champion hexdrinker is a stupidly gold efficient item that can GUARANTEE absolute safety in a 1v1 scenario with no mechanical counterplay or skill required. Just simplistic brain dead stats. Mages aren't supposed to counter assassins? Fine, what about something like Fizz VS talon/zed? 

Once an AD mid laner grabs hex it becomes impossible to kill them. Zed and Talon will come out even in a trade and have the power to turn a trade into an all in. in an all in you definitely won't kill them so the only choice is to play the lane passively at that point. This is also a pointless way to go about it because both of them have power ranged abilities to attempt to poke at you until they can set you up for a kill. The disadvantage only grows as the game goes on when they start stacking lethality items and start to massively out damage you because once again AD champions have access to a powerful line of items that there is no comparison for in AP itemization. Once they get duskblade it's completely over. 

Completely negating a champions capabilities with brainless stats is a privilege that should be exclusive for tanks, not something you can pick up on anything you want.

First of all, assassins are inherently more difficult to play than mages. That was true before and Riot specifically went out of their way to make it even more true with the assassin update. They want assassins to be difficult to play. If the kit is inherently already hard to use, they can have a break on the item being brain dead.

AP assassins getting the short end of the stick doesn't stop the argument. It just means that AP assassins need to stop existing. If Riot wants to appropriately balance their game they should normalize the assassin class and make them all AD. 

"Once an AD mid laner grabs hex it becomes impossible to kill them". This isn't an issue. You don't need to kill your lane opponent. You can keep them at bay by softening them up with damage from range and then just out CS them and move on with your life. There is no reason to fight a battle you know you can't win. Thankfully, you have the range and the CC to avoid the fight altogether.

"Once again AD champions have access to a powerful line of items that there is no comparison for in AP itemization"

That's the fucking point of my original post. Do not compare items for two classes. They are separate. They are not equal. There should be no comparison. They have different roles, different goals, different reasons for being picked. Assassins have higher damage on their items. Yes. That is because mages have more damage in their kits. If I drop Tibbers on three enemy champions he will do over 600 damage instantly. The only assassin who has that much raw AOE damage in their kit is Katarina and Evelynn, and both of them are a lot easier to counter or avoid than Annie. 

Do not compare mages to assassins. This is the point I am making. This is the point Riot understands. That is why no one does anything about Hexdrinker no matter how many times you cry, no matter how many threads you make. They already know that mages are better than assassins in terms of utility and AOE, they don't need to worry that assassins have raw single target damage and sustain.

>"Once an AD mid laner grabs hex it becomes impossible to kill them". This isn't an issue. You don't need to kill your lane opponent. You can keep them at bay by softening them up with damage from range and then just out CS them and move on with your life. There is no reason to fight a battle you know you can't win. Thankfully, you have the range and the CC to avoid the fight altogether.

Out CS them? Yea, if you're not fighting them for CS, you're getting zoned. If you're using your CC every time they walk up, you're going to run out of Mana very fast (and are very impressive if you hit every CC).

---

Do you know how awful it feels to play a _mid lane_ Mage and not have the chance to get fed in lane? Not even plays utility based champs. Hell, I doubt anyone playing Lux mid is playing her for her utility. Most AP mid players _want to be damage carries_. And with all the nerfs to AP values over the past two years, _getting fed is the only way to do it_. And what do we get to not do when playing against an Assassin?

So then ban out the assassins. Zed is way more common than Talon. Ban Zed every game, that removes half of the common Hexdrinker users. Problem solved. 

Or, you could roam. You could play a bot lane mage and get fed that way. Zyra and Brand play well bot. You could go top lane and prey on melee champions. Riot is making changes to Zyra and Morgana to let them jungle. You can do that soon as well.

Personally every one of my bans will go to Zoe for a long time.

Roaming against an Assassin will not go in your favor, they are simply the better roamers with itemization to support it. Top Lane is very volatile in playing a mid Mage. Either you kill them more than once early, or they tank up and never die unless they're a skirmisher like Riven. The changes to Morg and Zyra are aimed at better mid laning, not jungle. I hate to be a dick here, but assassins NEED to be stronger in this early situation. The entire identity of an assassin is a champion that can beat and shut down high damage champions in a 1v1. If syndra/any ranged champion was able to completely avoid the early game strengths provided by picking an assassin, assassins would just be completely useless. Syndra scales well into teamfights, and while zed does scale very well for an assassin, (fuck zed) he doesn't bring the same strengths to a team that syndra/whoever can mid lane.

Also I don't want to completely shut down your argument here, but syndra/every mage can buy an early stopwatch or get a free one this season (and 600g discount on zhonyas), so I'd honestly argue that mages actually benefited _even more_ than AD assassins from the preseason changes. Especially considering the removal of flat MR glyphs.

You have to understand a difference between "being stronger" and "completely negating with zero effort". First one is allright. Zed should have an advantage against Syndra, but he should also be able to die if outplayed. What OP posted is the second one - Zed simply picked a ~~mastery~~ rune and bought a cheap item, and now Syndra literally can't do anything no matter how good she is. If Zed decides to rush on her when he comes back, she's dead no matter how well she plays - you can't outplay a shitload of free defensive boosts. There is absolutely zero skill and effort involved from Zed in order to become all but unkillable by any mage. You can't possibly claim that is fair.

Stopwatch is also an absolutely terrible early buy. First of all, it's a highly snowbally meta - meaning that spending 600 gold on an item that gives zero stats is putting a giant neon sign over your head saying "team please carry me, I just put myself insanely behind by throwing 600 gold down the drain when I need them the most". That's 3 kills worth of gold. If Zed gets 3 kills, he snowballs the game. If Syndra gets them, she might survive a single all-in. Second, it's a ONE use item - aside from paradox of spending 600 gold to deny a single kill worth 200, it leaves you with a literal dud in your inventory. Meanwhile your opponent spent his 600 gold on actual stats, crushing any hope you might have had of fighting him.

Imagine if instead of Hexdrinker there was an item that built into Maw and gave a one-time shield with zero stats. Who in their right mind would ever buy it? Oh, and free stopwatch is only a 300g discount on Zhonyas instead of 600.

Riot is all high on words like "counterplay" or "interactivity". So where are those in Hexdrinker+Orb combo? Where is counterplay to negating a massive part of my burst without even having to press a button? And why should I even try to interact with an opponent who gets to be unkillable with zero skill or effort involved? He can kill me easily, I can't kill him at all - so why even bother with anything other than passively farming (you know, the thing Riot also hates and has repeatedly nerfed champions able to do that very effectively).

Outplay should not be zero effort. Syndra waited to ult Zed specifically after he ulted so he wouldn't dodge the ult via his own ult.  His blunder should have resulted in a death.

Also, Double shields on CD is **not better** than a one time use statless stasis? That a joke?

Zed would have the option of using shadows to poke down Syndra and scare her into using a stasis.  Syndra used most of her spells on a Zed that all-in'd her at low health and he escaped relatively unscathed. And the best part is that it will come back after its CD.

Well or Zed used a rune slot solely dedicated to being able to survive a Syndra ult hugely benefitting the other team members later into the game as it doesn't affect them that much. But instead rant on boards about how your Syndra skill button doesn't oneshot a Zed anymore when he buys some items and appropriately spikes in the game.
It's not a "one-shot." A syndra ult should kill that zed... The dude has like 1/4 of his hp.
